clinical_study.brief_title: Observational Study of the Clinico-biological Evolution and Standard of Care Offered to Patients With Ebola Virus Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Observational Study of the Clinico-biological Evolution and Standard of Care Offered to Patients With Ebola Virus Disease

brief_summary.textblock: This study highlighted the possibility, even in epidemic settings, of providing advanced supportive care for patients with VMEs. Indeed, while the prospect of offering any invasive medical care was widely discussed in 2014 in West Africa with the aim of limiting the exposure of caregivers, the epidemic of 2018-2019 has on the contrary seen the development of a number of medical care strategies, in parallel with the deployment of specific treatments. This study aims to describe a cohort of patients receiving this upgraded supportive care during the tenth epidemic in the DRC.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through the end of the hospitalization, with an average of 11 days

intervention.description: (i) advanced clinical and biological monitoring system (ii) symptomatic treatment adapted to the patient's needs, such as antibiotic therapy, oxygen therapy and blood transfusion; (iii) dialysis or mechanical ventilation.

study_pop.textblock: All patients with positive RT-PCR admitted in ETC's during the inclusion period were included in the study
